briefdescription.para: Configure font settings for use with QgsTextRenderer.
Configure font settings for use with QFont objects.
Available button modes.
Construct a new font button.

detaileddescription.para: Use parent to attach a parent QWidget to the dialog. Use dialogTitle string to define the title to show in the text settings dialog.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current QFont set by the widget.

detaileddescription.para:
This is only used when mode() is ModeQFont.
setCurrentFont()

briefdescription.para: Returns the title for the text settings dialog window.
Returns the map canvas associated with the widget.
Returns the current button mode.
Sets the title for the text settings dialog window.
Sets a map canvas to associate with the widget.

detaileddescription.para:
This allows the widget to fetch current settings from the map canvas, such as current scale.
mapCanvas()

briefdescription.para: Sets the current button mode.

detaileddescription.para:
This can be used to toggle between the full capabilities of the button (for configuring QgsTextFormat/QgsTextRenderer objects) and a cut-back version for configuring QFont object properties (i.e. with no color settings or the other advanced options QgsTextFormat allows).
mode()

briefdescription.para: Returns the current text formatting set by the widget.

detaileddescription.para:
This is only used when mode() is ModeTextRenderer.
setTextFormat()

briefdescription.para: Copies the current text color to the clipboard.

detaileddescription.para:
This is only used when mode() is ModeTextRenderer.
pasteColor()

briefdescription.para: Copies the current text format to the clipboard.
Pastes a color from the clipboard to the text format.

detaileddescription.para:
If clipboard does not contain a valid color or string representation of a color, then no change is applied. This is only used when mode() is ModeTextRenderer.
copyColor()

briefdescription.para: Pastes a format from the clipboard.

detaileddescription.para:
If clipboard does not contain a valid format then no change is applied.
copyFormat()

briefdescription.para: Sets the current color for the text.

detaileddescription.para: Will emit a changed signal if the color is different to the previous text color. This is only used when mode() is ModeTextRenderer.

briefdescription.para: Sets the current text font to show in the widget.

detaileddescription.para:
This is only used when mode() is ModeQFont.
currentFont()

briefdescription.para: Sets the current text format to show in the widget.

detaileddescription.para:
This is only used when mode() is ModeTextRenderer.
textFormat()

briefdescription.para: Emitted when the widget's text format settings are changed.
Creates the drop-down menu entries.
Attempts to parse mimeData as a color, either via the mime data's color data or by parsing a textual representation of a color.

simplesect.para: true if mime data could be intrepreted as a color

parameterdescription.para: will be set to true if mime data also included an alpha component

briefdescription.para: Create a color icon for display in the drop-down menu.

memberdef.argsstring: (QSize size=QSize(50, 50), const QgsTextFormat *tempFormat=nullptr, const QFont *tempFont=nullptr) const
memberdef.name: createDragIcon

briefdescription.para: Creates a drag icon showing the current font style.
Attempts to parse mimeData as a QFont.

simplesect.para: true if mime data could be intrepreted as a QFont

briefdescription.para: Attempts to parse mimeData as a text format.

simplesect.para: true if mime data could be intrepreted as a format

briefdescription.para: Regenerates the text preview.

detaileddescription.para: If color is specified, a temporary color preview is shown instead.

briefdescription.para: A button for customizing QgsTextFormat settings.

detaileddescription.para: The button will open a detailed text format settings dialog when clicked. An attached drop-down menu allows for copying and pasting text styles, picking colors for the text, and for dropping colors from other color widgets.

The button can be used in two different modes(). The default behavior is to include all settings used for configuring QgsTextFormat/QgsTextRenderer classes. A cut down mode (without settings for color) is also available when the resultant font is used only in a QFont object.
